name: Hotel Gastronomique De Echoput

reviews.text: Just had the pleasure of staying a night at the Echoput (room 1.04) with my spouse and daughter. And we liked it very much: the modern architecture and styling of the rooms, the friendliness of the staff, the quiet surroundings (though the highway is quite nearby; didn't hear anything of it because our room was located at the back of the hotel). When we arrived, there was a bag of candy on one of the pillows for my daughter which was a very nice touch. The room itself was quite spacious (my spouse, daughter (in an extra bed at an extra charge btw) and me stayed in one room, but we had plenty of room left), very nice bathroom (liked the powerful shower). We made use of room service, that arrived quite swiftly and the food was quite nice (they made some very tasty french fries for my daughter). Having had dinner, we made use of the swimming pool. Although it is not a gigantic pool, we had great fun (had the pool for ourselves). If we had to complain, then it would be about the bed: it was far too soft for us. The next morning, we had breakfast which was quite nice. Went for a swim again, and then we checked out to go to Apenheul (nearby the hotel, just as Julianatoren). We paid around 260 Euros (the room itself was 129 Euros (which is a bargain, actually), the rest was for the extra bed, the room service and breakfast). Yes, maybe that's pricey (particularly the extras) but it was worth it. Had no problems with our cell phones btw. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Had a great stay at the Echoput!

reviews.text: I've reviewed this hotel before. Stayed here a few times now. Liked it very much but wasn't pleased with the room service. Room service much better now. But, and this can be a very big but if you stay here. There is NO cell phone reception in the hotel. I'm not sure if the hotel has some sort of jamming device to get some extra telephone revenues or they just happen to be located in the only place in the Netherlands were there is no reception.
reviews.title: no cell phone reception

reviews.text: This might be nice when you're on holiday, but is killing when you're on business.
reviews.title: Very quiet, stylish hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is located just outside Apeldoorn, one stop by bus (102) after Julianatoren. Bus top at hotel, which is 50 meter from the busy road through the forest. I had a room in the back (2.04( where the traffic could be heard still on the balcony but inside the room it was very very quiet. The decoration is sober, all black and white and beige or red. You have to like this style, but the bed is very large and super-comfortable.
reviews.title: Topspot

reviews.text: 32 inch TV, fixed on the wall, above the black table. A few English channels (BBC1, CNN, CNBC, Sport( but mostly Dutch and German and 2 French. DVD player can be gotten in the reception. Take your own DVDs, no movie channels, also no pay-TV. There were a few books and magazines in the room all in Dutch. There is a small library, also almost all books in Dutch. There is a shop with wines and luxury products and even jars with food that it made in the restaurant (about 18 Euro).
reviews.title: very special

description: Hotel Gastronomique De Echoput is located in Hoog Soeren, in the province Gelderland. This 5-star hotel is located among the crown properties of the royal palace 'Paleis het Loo', to the northwest of the city Apeldoorn. In the unspoilt natural surroundings guests can freely give in to wealth and luxury. The hotel is also an ideal location for a business meeting.In Hotel Gastronomique De Echoput you will find yourself at a historic location in the lovely nature area 'De Veluwe.' The hotel is surrounded by eleven thousand hectares of woods. Crown property 'Het Loo' is a vast country estate that is partially the private property of the Dutch monarch. Hotel de Echoput, which means 'echoing well', owes its name to the nearby historic well that dates from the French period. The hotel itself is decorated with earth tones and lovely materials, which has given it a luxurious and tasteful atmosphere. Hotel Gastronomique De Echoput has been developed by Peter Klosse, who is famous for his combinations of meat specialities and wines. It goes without saying that guests can have a great dinner in the hotel.In De Echoput guests can book not only rooms, but suites as well. The hotel overlooks the beautiful woods surrounding the hotel. These can be admired from your balcony or the romantic loggia. All rooms are equipped with a kingsze bed and a private bathroom with a toilet and shower, or bath. The rooms are also equipped with underfloor heating. Furthermore, the air conditioning in the rooms will keep the temperature at the right level. Guests can use a free wireless Internet connection and a laptop safe in the rooms or have a drink from the minibar. The hotel further offers a laundry service.The hotel's surroundings are simply breathtaking. Guests can explore these on foot or by using the bikes the hotel has for rent. At the sime time, the hotel itself has enough to offer as well. There is an indoor pool and a sauna. In the fitness room guests can do some exercise and on the indoor golf green they can practice their swing. For meetings, guests can use one of the three conference rooms in De Echoput. After a long and busy day guests can unwind at the hotel's outdoor café.Food and DrinksFrom 7:00 to 10:30 hours \ morning guests can have breakfast. The hotel serves an extensive hot and cold buffet. From Tuesday to Friday you have the option from 12:30 to 14:30 for lunch in the restaurant Echoput. From Monday to Saturday you can also dine from 18:30 to 21:30. The Echoput is not for nothing called \ 'Hotel Gastronomique \'. The restaurant of The Echoput one pays much attention to taste and flavor combinations. Especially finding matching wines is an ongoing challenge. You can find culinary delights. On sunny days, lunch and dinner on the terrace. From Monday to Sunday's Bistro & Flavours open between 11:00 and 21:30 for lunch and dinner. Bistro & Wine Bar Flavours is a restaurant with a charming yet casual setting. Shown in sober black and red. Guests can go for coffee, a glass of wine and lunch or dinner from the Flavours card.InternetGuests can use a wireless Internet connection in the entire hotel, free of charge.Other information- The hotel does not have a 24-hour reception.- The hotel has one special room for guests with a disability.- Pets are not allowed.- Luggage can be stored at the hotel.SurroundingsDe Echoput is located in the crown property of the royal palace 'Paleis Het Loo'. Lovely woods and heaths are waiting to be explored by bike or on foot. The hotel can give several suggestions for a good excursion. The magnificent natural surroundings can be admired under the expert supervision of a guide. Guests can also have a relaxing day at a beauty farm in the nearby Putten. The money zoo 'Apenheul' and the museum of modern art 'Kröller-Möller' in 'Nationaal Park de Hoge Veluwe' are close to the hotel.
